name: Chicken Vegetable Soup
description: Healing homemade chicken broth with plenty of vegetables. Comforting and nutritious, perfect for cold days.

instructions.instruction: Heat olive oil in large pot over medium heat. Add onion and saut√© 5 minutes until soft.
instructions.tip: Onions should be translucent but not caramelized.

instructions.instruction: Add garlic, carrots, and celery. Cook 3 minutes, stirring.
Add chicken breast whole to pot.
Add water, bay leaves, and thyme sprigs.
Bring to boil, then reduce heat. Partially cover and simmer 25-30 minutes until chicken is cooked.
instructions.tip: Skim foam with spoon for clear broth.

instructions.instruction: Remove chicken from pot and let cool slightly on plate.
Add potato cubes to soup. Cook 10 minutes.
Shred chicken with two forks. Remove skin and bones.
instructions.tip: Easier to shred while still warm.

instructions.instruction: Add optional noodles and cook 5 minutes.
Add shredded chicken back to soup.
Season with salt and pepper. Remove bay leaves and thyme sprigs.
Sprinkle fresh parsley and serve hot.

tips: Chicken broth boosts immune system and helps with colds.
For richer broth, don't remove chicken bones - cook extra hour.
Soup tastes even better the next day - flavors meld.
Cut vegetables same size for even cooking.
Dried herbs work too - use half the amount.
storageInfo: Refrigerate 4-5 days, freeze 3 months. Noodle version doesn't freeze well.
servingSuggestion: Serve hot with crusty bread. Perfect healing food when sick.
variations: Add pasta or rice for more filling soup.
Add turmeric and ginger for 'golden soup' - anti-inflammatory.
Make avgolemono with lemon and egg.
